alfredsnippet.snippet:
Sir Oliver Lodge, F.R.S., The Geometrisation of Physics, and its supposed Basis on the Michelson-Morley Experiment. Nature, Feb 17, 1921, p.796

"It is undeniable that mathematicians, with a self-denying ordinance about coefficients, can thus attain remarkable criteria, and are able to anticipate definite results; but we need not seek to engraft their modes of expression on the real world of physics."
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - Sir Oliver Lodge on the Application of Math to the Real World of Physics
